title: Complex Problem-Solving Strategies in Mathematics Instructional Design Using Concept Mapping

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics education experience and understanding of simple instructional design methodologies
context.additional_context: Enhancing real-time lesson design capabilities for current elementary school teachers using smartphone-based online collaboration tools

learning_goals: Learners can visualize core elements of mathematical instructional design problems through concept maps.
Learners can present problem-solving solutions reflecting peer feedback during collaboration-based concept map creation.
Learners can systematically deconstruct and reconstruct complex mathematical instructional design problems using smartphone-based tools.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
